channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Apprehension in Denmark ahead of talks about Greenland with Vance
item.description: Leaders from Denmark and Greenland will meet with top U.S. officials in Washington on Wednesday to try to find a way out of a crisis caused by President Trump repeated demands to annex Greenland.
item.content:encoded: Leaders from Denmark and Greenland will meet with top U.S. officials in Washington on Wednesday to try to find a way out of a crisis caused by President Trump repeated demands to annex Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Adrienne Murray

item.title: Minnesota federal prosecutors resign after DOJ push to investigate Renee Good's widow
item.description: Federal prosecutors in Minnesota have resigned after the DOJ pushed for an investigation into the widow of Renee Good, after Good was fatally shot last week by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded: Federal prosecutors in Minnesota have resigned after the DOJ pushed for an investigation into the widow of Renee Good, after Good was fatally shot last week by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: Trump calls on Iranians to keep protesting but the death toll is rising
item.description: President Trump calls on Iranians to keep protesting, but the regime is cracking down hard and the death toll is rising.
item.content:encoded: President Trump calls on Iranians to keep protesting, but the regime is cracking down hard and the death toll is rising.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: The 2026 Tiny Desk Contest begins
item.description: NPR Music's search for the next great undiscovered artist to play a Tiny Desk concert kicks off today. Host and series producer Bobby Carter shares what the judges are looking for in entries.
item.content:encoded: NPR Music's search for the next great undiscovered artist to play a Tiny Desk concert kicks off today. Host and series producer Bobby Carter shares what the judges are looking for in entries.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Carter

item.title: What Trump's fight with Powell could mean for the Fed's future
item.description: President Trump has been trying to bully the Federal Reserve into cutting interest rates. It's a gambit that could lead to more inflation.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has been trying to bully the Federal Reserve into cutting interest rates. It's a gambit that could lead to more inflation.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Markets and restaurants return to Gaza, but few can afford the expensive price tag
item.description: New eateries are popping up in Gaza after months of famine, but it's pricey and many people still rely on aid to survive.
item.content:encoded: New eateries are popping up in Gaza after months of famine, but it's pricey and many people still rely on aid to survive.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Will these tech trends take off in 2026?
item.description: Every year, the MIT Technology Review publishes a list of 10 breakthroughs poised to take off in the coming year. Amy Nordrum, executive editor of operations there, talks through this year's entries.
item.content:encoded: Every year, the MIT Technology Review publishes a list of 10 breakthroughs poised to take off in the coming year. Amy Nordrum, executive editor of operations there, talks through this year's entries.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: How Minnesota faith communities are resisting aggressive immigration operations
item.description: As immigration enforcement actions have ramped up in Minnesota, people of faith have been at the forefront of the response to ICE detentions and the killing of Renee Macklin Good by a federal agent.
item.content:encoded:
As immigration enforcement actions have ramped up in Minnesota, people of faith have been at the forefront of the response to ICE detentions and the killing of Renee Macklin Good by a federal agent.

(Image credit: Evan Frost for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: With the lightest touch, scientists search da Vinci's art for DNA
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Science correspondent Richard Stone about recent developments in the search for Leonardo da Vinci's DNA.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Science correspondent Richard Stone about recent developments in the search for Leonardo da Vinci's DNA.
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: Wyoming is among the states that could cut property taxes used for local services
item.description: Wyoming lawmakers are in the front of a national trend of cutting or eliminating property taxes. But they face a challenge from activists seeking to save money for police, firefighters and libraries.
item.content:encoded: Wyoming lawmakers are in the front of a national trend of cutting or eliminating property taxes. But they face a challenge from activists seeking to save money for police, firefighters and libraries.
item.dc:creator: Chris Clements
